citation.article-title: Alteromonas colwelliana sp. nov., an isolate from oyster habitats.

p.s: Description of Alteromonas colwelliana sp. nov.
Alteromonas colwelliana (col. well' i. a. na. L. fem. adj. colwelliana, named for Rita Colwell for her contributions to marine microbiology)
The description is based on one strain.
Pleomorphic cells 0.5 to 1.5 μm in diameter and 1.0 to 20 μm long when growing on surfaces, in nutrient-poor media, or during late growth phases.
Helical forms sometimes evident.
In rich media, motile cells 0.7 to 1.5 μm in diameter and 1.0 to 3.0 μm long occur.
Gram negative.
Not acid fast.
No endospores.
Aerobic.
Single polar flagellum.
On marine agar 2216 young colonies are circular and about 1 mm diameter, with convex elevations and undulate margins.
After 1 week of incubation their form becomes irregular, and they enlarge to 5 mm in diameter.
In liquid media, growth produces uniform turbidity without pellicle.

In rich media (e.g., brain heart infusion medium containing 3% NaCl [final concentration, 3.5%]), large agar 2216 young colonies are circular and about 1 mm diameter, with convex elevations and undulate margins.
After 1 week of incubation their form becomes irregular, and they enlarge to 5 mm in diameter.
In liquid media, growth produces uniform turbidity without pellicle.
In rich media (e.g., brain heart infusion medium containing 3% NaCl [final concentration, 3.5%]), large masses of mucoid flocculates form.
On all media, cells adhere to the surface of the growth vessel.
In media containing less than 0.5% glucose, A. colwelliana turns the media dark brown during late growth phases.
Amino acids are required for growth; L-aspartic acid and L-glutamic acid together support growth as carbon sources (28).
Yeast extract is growth stimulating.
The temperature range for growth is 8 to 30°C.
Most rapid growth occurs at 25°C.
The NaCl concentration for optimum growth is 2 to 4% (wt/vol).
The NaCl growth range is 1 to 5%.
The optimum pH range is 7.4 to 7.8.
Constitutive glucose phosphopyruvate transferase system not detected.
Marine broth 2216 and brain heart infusion medium (Difco) become alkaline with growth.
Catalase, gelatinase, amylase, deoxyribonuclease, and phosphatase are produced.
Grows on asparagine, D-gluconate, D-glucosamine, fumarate, L-histidine, and α-ketoglutarate as sole carbon sources.
No acid produced from arbutin, trehalose, sucrose, D-cellobiose, D-mannose, myoinositol, D-mannitol, sorbitol, salicin, and L-arabinose in OF basal medium (Difco).
Tween 20, Tween 40, Tween 60, and Tween 80 are hydrolyzed.
Sensitive to dyes except neutral red.
Resistant to bile, vibriostatic agent 0/129, and tellurite.
Susceptible to 20 mg of rifampin per ml.
Autochthonous to estuarine oyster water.
Not known to be associated with diseased invertebrates.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 46 mol%.
The type strain is strain LST-W (= ATCC 39565).
